value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">irrepressible instinct <del>forms</del> flow into <del>miracle</del> <add place="above">regular channels</add> players</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">& these form <del>their</del> <del>But</del> to <del>confine – to</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">& to induce the rhymers & the mummers, the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">jugglers & the bear leaders to put off their</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">pagan leaves, their bells, their [moblets?], &</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>robe themselves</del> in the service of the Christian</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">God.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">That was the other bond between the great</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">house & the cottage. For though the great,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>with</del> <del>their</del> <del>with their acga</del> speaking</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">French as easily as English, with their Latin & greek</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">tags on their tongues, <del>despised the</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">must despise the jargon of the peasant, they</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">shared the superstitions. An old woman in a</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>cott</del> hovel was to the King himself even,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the [venal?] of an unclean spirit. A dun</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">chicken, she said, sucked on her chin. When the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="object" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#obj-pill" key="Pilliwinks">pilliwinks</rs> were applied to her, she confessed</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">on all Hallows E'en last she with 200</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">witches had gone to sea, each one in a</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">[riddle?] a sieve drinking & making merry</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">till they came to the Kerk of <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-nber" key="Berwick, North">N. Berwick</rs></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">in <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-loth" key="Lothian">
            <choice>
              <sic>Lowthian</sic>
              <corr>Lothian</corr>
            </choice></rs> where they landed & danced a</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">reel. When the <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-denb" key="Denbigh, Earl of">Earl of 
            <choice>
              <sic>Denby</sic>
              <corr>Denbigh</corr>
            </choice></rs> died a witch was</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">[illeg.] in the corner of his room. She confessed</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">how she had thrown a cat into the sea &</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">raised a storm that had sunk the Kings ships.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The great house, then, when the nobles read</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the <rs type="literary-work" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-faer" key="Faerie Queene, The">Faery Queen</rs> aloud, was connected</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">with the village by <del>these</del> superstitions, needs, beliefs.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-espe" key="Spenser, Edmund">Spenser</rs> himself heard the rhymers & the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">impudent bards. <del>It was at</del> He saw,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">at     in        , the Green man. It was</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">said that he was present at the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">pageant, in <del>wh</del> <del>queen</del> played before</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Q <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-eliz" key="Elizabeth I">Elizabeth</rs> in 15– . It was <del>an</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">a revival – already time had given</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">their customs curiosity, a standing against the [past?]</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">For already the other house was being built.</l>

<add xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" place="margin">
            <l>jugglers, [rhymers?],</l>
            <l>& sacred trees, &</l>
            <l>holy wells; &</l>
            <l>mummers</l>
            <quote source="" rend="block">
              <l>Wanton bardes</l>
